intro: Gyrostachys reverchonii, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has small, compound leaves and produces cylindrical, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is well adapted to harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it survive in poor soils and low water conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
